intro: Seseli cinereum, commonly known as gray seseli, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in rocky or dry soils and is often found in open woodlands or along stream banks. Seseli cinereum is known for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
